___________________________________________________



Saturday, April 4th, 2009

[ K O N T R O L ]

minimal techno + avant house
every 1st Saturday at The Endup



featuring from Chile:


PIER BUCCI - LIVE

(Crosstown Rebels . Cadenza . Cynosure . Contexterrior)
(Wagon Repair . Vendetta . BPitch Control . Cocoon)

Originally capturing the international spotlight alongside fellow
Chilean artists Ricardo Villalobos and Luciano, Pier Bucci
has over the last decade become one of the most respected
names in modern techno, due in part to tracks like 2007's
monster hit, "Hay Consuelo". His unique live performance,
which fuses Latin rhythms and elegant melodies with a
German sense of efficiency and dancefloor-friendly beats,
has landed him slots at top clubs across the globe, as well
as appearances at most major festivals including Sonar,
MUTEK, and DEMF.



and from Toronto via Berlin:


JEREMY P. CAULFIELD

(Dumb-Unit . Trapez . WMF Records)
(Ware . Num . Alphahouse . Adjunct)

As a DJ of 15 years and an integral figure in the rise of
the Toronto techno scene, Jeremy P. Caulfield is a rare
example of an artist who can deftly combine experience,
skill, and forward-thinking ideas in style. In addition to
running the acclaimed "neuro-minimal" label Dumb-Unit,
these days Jeremy plays the world's best clubs and festivals
nearly every weekend, thanks to his tricked-out, re-edit
heavy sets which have established him as one of North
America's finest DJs.



with [KONTROL] residents:


ALLAND BYALLO  (Nightlight . Auralism . Leibe*Detail)
http://www.myspace.com/alland

SAMMY D  (Classic . Dirtybird . Utensil)
http://www.myspace.com/sammydoyle

NIKOLA BAYTALA  (S.W.A.T. . Robsoul . Junior Boys Own)
http://www.myspace.com/nikolaswat

CRAIG KUNA  (Platform . ESDJCO)
http://www.myspace.com/craig1


____________________________________________________


The ENDUP
401 6th St @ Harrison, SF
10pm - 6am / 21+ / $15 til 2am
http://www.theendup.com

FREE before 11pm!

____________________________________________________


[KONTROL] on MySpace:
http://www.myspace.com/kontrolsf

Flyer front:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K46/K46F.jpg

Flyer back:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K46/K46B.jpg

Poster:
http://www.kontrolsf.com/K46/K46P.jpg


___________________________________________________


PIER BUCCI

Pier Bucci is on a quest to create his own vision of complex
atmospheric rhythms. Much has been written about the recent emergence
of Chile as an unexpected source of cutting edge electronica. Pier,
alongside fellow countrymen and women are producing some of the finest
and most original electronic music at the moment.

Pier's own take on techno uses classic Latin rhythms and vocals, with
his love of abstract electronics, and Sheffield bleeps, combining this
with his haunting Andean melodies, whilst colorful characters zip
through his music, makes a lively collage of influences, underpinned
by solid dancefloor beats.

A brief history of the last ten years show's Pier to be very busy.
>From the first releases in the late 90's on Dandy Jack's Ruta 5
Austral compilation, four acclaimed e.p.'s and a highly acclaimed
album for Crosstown Rebels. The fruits of his collaborations with
Luciano, bore the Monne Automnne [Lo-Fi Stereo, Germany] and
Lucien-n-Luciano album projects for labels such as Peacefrog and
Cadenza, Skipsapien together with Daniel Nieto [u-cover, Belgium;
Mutek Rec, Canada], Mambotur with Argenis Brito [Multicolor, Germany],
Bucci/Pink Elln together with Tobias Freund [Cynosure Records, Canada]
and works with his brother Andres as Bucci [WMF Rec, Berlin; Cynosure
Records, Canada] have been equally well received.

Last year we had releases on Wagon Repair, Cocoon, Cynosure and
remixes for BPitch Control. The single of Hay Consuelo and the Chilo=E9
e.p. for the Rebels.

In 2008 Pier has and the soon to be released album collaboration with
Max Loderbauer and Argenis Brito as Maluco on Karaoke Kalk and further
Pier Bucci e.p.'s are to follow in this year.

After all this studio time and experience, it's easy to understand why
Pier's live set is known as one the best around. His explosive
combination of Latin & European influences, dynamically delivered, is
always guaranteed dancefloor entertainment.


=3D=3D=3D> LINKS:

http://www.discogs.com/artist/pier%20bucci

http://www.myspace.com/buccipier

__________________________________________________________________


JEREMY P. CAULFIELD

At a time when so much techno feels like endless variations on a
played-out theme, it=92s heartening to know that there are still a
handful of artists, labels and DJs who can combine experience, skill
and forward-looking ideals in style. Step forward Jeremy P. Caulfield,
who amply ticks all of the above boxes.

As proprietor of leading neuro-minimal imprint Dumb-Unit, DJ of
widely-acclaimed repute, and occasional producer of stripped-back,
ominous dancefloor bombs, Jeremy has emerged from his early days on
the Canadian techno circuit to become a leading light of today=92s
underground club scene. Using his fifteen years of DJing experience as
a springboard, Jeremy has utilised Dumb-Unit as a pivotal platform for
the blossoming careers of artists including Butane, Lee Curtiss, Sweet
N=92 Candy and Seph, loosely defining a hinterland micro-scene of murky,
intricate sounds that play with the darkest recesses of the mind while
remaining firmly attached the propulsive drive of the dance-floor.

It=92s an ambiguous definition best articulated by his series of
Detached:Works mix tapes and CDs, which over the course of three
volumes and 10 years neatly plots Jeremy=92s evolution from sparky
underground enthusiast to undisputed connoisseur of finely-tuned
contemporary techno. From early residencies at Toronto=92s legendary
Blue and Fukhouse parties (where he knocked around with like-minded
local jocks Adam Marshall, Ian Guthrie and Jeff Milligan, while
playing alongside techno deities like Richie Hawtin, Derrick May and
Jeff Mills), Jeremy=92s established himself as one of North America=92s
finest DJs. In 2008 alone, alongside his residency at Watergate, (in
his adopted home of Berlin) Jeremy has played nearly every weekend
across the globe, including gigs at renown clubs and festivals such as
Fabric, Fuse, Mutek, and the Sonne Mond Sterne Festival and tours of
Japan, Australia and South America .

Meanwhile, his rare but intricate rocking live shows surface every
once in a while to remind us that his darkly-tinged, boiled-down beats
and distantly unsettling grooves are one of the most precious jewels
in the jagged DU crown. Check his killer releases Dumb-Unit, Trapez
and WMF if you need any proof.

Somewhere between his smart, re-edit heavy sets, his vigorously spiky
artist releases, and his scandalously consistent label, there lurks
the charred, elusive heart of Jeremy P. Caulfield. The fun part is
trying to find it.


=3D=3D=3D> LINKS:

nd-dumb-unit-records/

Subject: [sfraves] bsp: PULSE tonight at Paradise Lounge

Not sure if it's considered afterhours, but we're going till 
4am, come by and say hi if you're around :-)

Friday :: March 27 :: 2009

PULSE Presents 3-L-3-TRONIC Live!

We know, we know... everyone is a DJ. So what makes 3-L-3-TRONIC 
different? They bring energy and entertainment beyond anything 
you've seen or heard before. One male and one female together as 
a collective, each bringing their own unique talents and styles. 
Performers Vitamindevo and Bianca Dino make 3-L-3-TRONIC. The DJ 
sets: bassy, dubby-breaks and progressive tech-house, blended 
with a unique collection of psy-breaks, electro, and 
chuggy-progressive finds, creating a low-end journey full of 
build-ups, break-downs, and break-throughs. 3-L-3-TRONIC Live 
adds live drums, vocals, original visuals, and more.

Track samples and live performance clips: 
http://www.myspace.com/3l3tronic

Main Floor:
3-L-3-TRONIC (Robot Heart | Beat Seeker | Tronic Visions)
Dutch (Opulent Temple)
Influence (Strategik | Swag)
Mace (Marta)

+ Pulse Residents Alixr, Kirill & Dhamma

Upstairs Loft:
Smoove (Newsbreakz)
Aaron Jae (Evil Breaks | Space Cowboys)
Laird (Get YER Freak On!)
Tamo & Via Jay (Angels of bAss)

Visuals by Viberation

9pm to 4am
21+ with ID

$10 before 11pm
$15 after

All proceeds benefit Healing Muses: http://www.healingmuses.org

Paradise Lounge
1501 Folsom St
San Francisco

--

> YES! That's correct, we've got ACID CIRCUS coming up THIS FRIDAY.  Do
> we really need to speak to Droid Behavior's role in LA Techno, or how
> these guys are fixtures at DEMF?  Well fine: Acid Circus has long
> established themselves along with creative parner Drumcell in the
> creation of some of the best warehouse, desert and essentially any
> location they've chosen to play at, in and around Los Angeles, and are
> well known throughout the US and elsewhere.  THIS FRIDAY, the preparty
> starts with Droid residents Subversive and DeanpauL at Killswitch
> Happy Hour at Underground SF, and then moves to Faktion at Anu to
> finish the night!
>
> ////////////////
>
> Half of the founders of Droid Behavior and Droid Recordings, ACID CIRCUS
> is comprised of brothers Vidal and Vangelis Vargas.  No strangers to
> tweaking and freqing everything within ear shot, over the last 5 years
> the members of acid circus have constantly displayed the art of techno
> live performance. Dropping tracks, remixes, samples, mashups, left
> hooks, and techno grime in and out of the mix has become an ultimate
> trip in pure crowd reaction at LA undergrounds.
> http://www.myspace.com/acidcircus
>
> Having played in locales as diverse as the Netherlands and the Middle East,
> SNOEK, aka That Fucking Guy/Meekrob heads up his own parties yet remains
> humble and works tirelessly to further the local techno scene any way he
> can.
> http://www.myspace.com/snoek
>

when i had you

everything and anything
now take it all

can't stop the pain
or you i'm thinking of

anything at all
take anything and everything

don't take my heart

X-ELNK-Trace: 6a880de683994333d4c20f6b8d69d8886924630f8852f17333af81b0af7e13b9993bc36f54f9fc11350badd9bab72f9c350badd9bab72f9c350badd9bab72f9c
X-Originating-IP: 67.101.214.9
X-Spam-Rating: taz3.hyperreal.org 1.6.2 0/1000/N
Subject: Re: [sfraves] medical marijuana

Hmm. . .

Depends on how you want to go about it.
Some doctors do ridiculous advertising, there's some "Pot Doc" guy who ads 
in local newspapers where I live,  I think there's a website, potdoc.com . 
Most doctors I've met like for the patient to have a record of some sort of 
their injury/illness. If a patient gets into trouble, or stopped by a dick 
cop, the doc is the person usually called.
    I myself have medical records from my orthopedic surgeon which basically 
go through all my surgeries and injuries, and my prop 215 supportive health 
practitioner is aware of them in case of any issues. I haven't had a problem 
though, I've been stopped and I tell the officer I have cannabis with me, 
they'd look at it and give it back, never had to show my med id. Federal law 
is diff though, so if you're on fed land like in the presidio in SF, than 
you can be fined and jailed for pretty much anything, arguing with the 
officers doesn't usually help either hehe.

    Some doctors however aren't as concerned I guess I could say, about the 
legal issues. Some think marijuana should be totally legal and believe in 
it's abilities and have no problem recommending it to anyone who feels it 
works for them.

    OCBC (Oakland cannabis buyers co-op, Don't think it's called that now 
though) has a card issuance tracking deal, and legal assistance for medical 
users. They're in Oakland, at like 17?? broadway, you could always go there 
and ask questions, it's on the north side of the street, easy to find.

There's also a state sponsored card program that's supposed to help id you 
if you're stopped by chp and such. It's supposed to help you if your 
transporting larger amounts of cannabis locally. . .
I don't know about that. . .I'm a little worried about any government 
related list with a bunch of federal law breakers names addresses and other 
information. I haven't looked much into that, but it's supposed to somewhat 
be required (if not now, than it will later).

Clubs are sort of plentiful, not as many as even just a year ago (thanks dea 
raids), but most areas have somewhere within a short drive. There used to be 
like 5-7 clubs here in the east bay around san leandro/san lorenzo/hayward. 
But the dea has had fun with it's raids lately, which are supposed to stop 
pretty much completely now that obama is in office (he's apparently a 
medical cannabis supporter). There has been changes and things are 
improving.

overall it's not as easy to get prescribed (it's actually recommended not 
prescribed) as it used to be but it's not difficult if you have a pretty 
legitimate reason for it's use. Of course you can probably find a doc who 
just signs a form and there you go. . .oh, and charges you $250. . . but I'm 
not necessarily in support of just giving it to anyone, it ultimately hurts 
the cause. . .

take care

aK
